comment:
A change petition a bridge too far? No. What's gone too far is how many men are at a disadvantage in the legal system and are wrongly accused and sentenced WITHOUT SUFFICIENT EVIDENCE. Johnny was kicked off two significant franchises due to Heards allegations. Meanwhile, Heard kept her film roles and her position as L'oreal spokesperson and is still trying to contest defamation lawsuits placed on her even after admitting she had lied about Johnny being the abuser. 
This DOES need to change. This could be your brothers and sons. Innocent men are suffering because there is a serious imbalance in whom to believe when it comes to "weaker and more vulnerable"  women versus a man. Men are mentally, emotionally, physically and sexually abused, too. This does need to change. And most disgustingly, this case lost spotlight when it was found Amber was the abuser and not Johnny. Now, no one CARES enough, because a rich celebrity male isn't going to be imprisoned for his crimes. Not only has this case lost interest to the masses, but what punishment did Amber actually receive for what she did??

If ANYONE reads this, and you want to see better chances for the innocent men YOU know personally, try and start a change with this. Because if you don't start caring now for those you don't know, no one will care for those you do. The Heard petition for Aquaman 2 is still active with over a million more signatures to go. Let's give the men WE know a better chance to be heard.

comment:
In my honest opinion based on evidence of Ms. Heard lying and being an abuser the following needs to happen:

1.Johnny needs him name 100% clear
2. Johnny needs his roles back
3. Amber needs to lose her roles
4. Amber needs to be held accountable 
5. Johnny needs help with substance abuse
6. Amber needs help with substance abuse
7. Amber needs strict staff that will keep her in check and keep her on her meds
8. When all is said and done media needs to let it die, fans need to move on

In regards to Emilia Clarke replacing Heard, I'm 50/50 on it. There is chemistry between her and Jason and she's a decent actress so I'm not opposed to it. I'm also not opposed to anyone else taking the role so long as the character is able to shine.

I loved Aquaman, but the movie only did well because of Jason, I don't really remember much of Amber in it. Poor acting or poor writing, I don't know.

But I won't see a film supporting abusers. I won't see films that take it out on the victims. No more fantastic beasts, pirates or aquaman if things don't change.

comment:
The sad part about Johnny is that he really is a beautiful soul we can see it. It shines through but with that also comes the torture of being in love amd when you love someone so much it takes alot to make you leave. All of those pictures of him slumped over, obviously on something, whether its alcohol or drugs the photos make it clear that he was in incredible pain. He used those things to numb the horrible and debilitating pain that comes from being abused in such a way. Emotional and physical abuse can leave such a scar on ones entire being, it can darken ones soul...

I just hope he can find his light within himself and i hope that he doesn't allow her to take that from him as well as everything shes already made him sacrifice.
